excerpt: AMC is conjuring up a third season of 'Anne Rice's Mayfair Witches.' Here's everything we know so far.
text: AMC is conjuring up more of Anne Rice‘s Mayfair Witches, renewing the Immortal Universe drama for Season 3, TVLine has learned. Additionally, Thomas Schnauz (Breaking Bad) is joining Esta Spalding as co-showrunner. “I am thrilled to welcome Tom Schnauz to our team for the third season of Mayfair Witches,” Spalding says in a statement. “A contemporary twist on the Salem story, it promises to be our most delicious yet.” Mayfair Witches‘ second season starred Alexandra Daddario as Rowan Fielding, Tongayi Chirisa as Ciprien Grieve, Jack Huston as Lasher, Harry Hamlin as Cortland Mayfair, Ben Feldman as Sam “Lark” Larkin and Alyssa Jirrels as Moira Mayfair. In the Season 2 finale, Julien (in Cortland’s body) and his fellow Scottish Mayfairs proceeded with their plan to kill Lasher, drink his blood and inherit the full extent of his power — only for Julien to betray his co-conspirators and keep all the power for himself. Rowan also drank from Julien’s cup, but only in the hopes of gaining enough power to bring Lasher back, which turned out to be a futile effort. Following Rowan’s relatively amicable split from Lark, the finale ended with her and Moira returning to their family home in New Orleans, where Julien was waiting for them in the shadows. As we head into Season 3, Rowan is “not going to back down from a battle” with Julien, Spalding tells TVLine. “And they really are mirrors a little bit. She’s not corrupted like Julien, and she hasn’t done the terrible things he’s done, but she does have the same kind of desire for power that he has.” Mayfair Witches is part of Anne Rice’s Immortal Universe on AMC, which also includes Interview With the Vampire and The Talamasca, the latter of which has not yet premiered. html:
AMC is conjuring up more of Anne Rice‘s Mayfair Witches, renewing the Immortal Universe drama for Season 3, TVLine has learned. Additionally, Thomas Schnauz (Breaking Bad) is joining Esta Spalding as co-showrunner.

“I am thrilled to welcome Tom Schnauz to our team for the third season of Mayfair Witches,” Spalding says in a statement. “A contemporary twist on the Salem story, it promises to be our most delicious yet.”

Mayfair Witches‘ second season starred Alexandra Daddario as Rowan Fielding, Tongayi Chirisa as Ciprien Grieve, Jack Huston as Lasher, Harry Hamlin as Cortland Mayfair, Ben Feldman as Sam “Lark” Larkin and Alyssa Jirrels as Moira Mayfair.

In the Season 2 finale, Julien (in Cortland’s body) and his fellow Scottish Mayfairs proceeded with their plan to kill Lasher, drink his blood and inherit the full extent of his power — only for Julien to betray his co-conspirators and keep all the power for himself.

Rowan also drank from Julien’s cup, but only in the hopes of gaining enough power to bring Lasher back, which turned out to be a futile effort. Following Rowan’s relatively amicable split from Lark, the finale ended with her and Moira returning to their family home in New Orleans, where Julien was waiting for them in the shadows.

As we head into Season 3, Rowan is “not going to back down from a battle” with Julien, Spalding tells TVLine. “And they really are mirrors a little bit. She’s not corrupted like Julien, and she hasn’t done the terrible things he’s done, but she does have the same kind of desire for power that he has.”

Mayfair Witches is part of Anne Rice’s Immortal Universe on AMC, which also includes Interview With the Vampire and The Talamasca, the latter of which has not yet premiered.
